channel.title: Kudlow & Company
channel.description:
"Kudlow & Company" combines the strengths of NBC News and CNBC, covering the day's major news stories with in-depth insight and interviews, along with a unique perspective on the business and economic impact of those stories.
Watch "Kudlow & Company" weekdays at 5pm/ET on CNBC.
channel.itunes:author: Larry Kudlow
channel.itunes:summary: "Kudlow & Company" combines the strengths of NBC News and CNBC, covering the day's major news stories with in-depth insight and interviews, along with a unique perspective on the business and economic impact of those stories.
channel.itunes:subtitle: CNBC's "Kudlow & Company" covers the day's major news stories, with a unique perspective on the impact on business and the economy.

item.title: Vice President Dick Cheney Interview
item.description:
In case you missed it...Larry's interview with Vice President Dick Cheney, as it aired on CNBC on January 19, 2006.
Topics include the war on terror, Iran's nuclear threat, and the economy.
item.itunes:author: Larry Kudlow
item.itunes:summary:
In case you missed it...Larry's interview with Vice President Dick Cheney, as it aired on CNBC on January 19, 2006.
Topics include the war on terror, Iran's nuclear threat, and the economy.

item.title: Looking Back, Looking Ahead
item.description:
As 2005 winds down, Larry takes a look back and a look ahead at the economic and political landscape with comments and predictions from some of his favorite guests:
Mike Holland, Holland & Company Chairman John Fund, WSJ OpinionJournal.com Columnist Charles Gasparino, CNBC On Air Editor
item.itunes:author: Larry Kudlow
item.itunes:summary:
As 2005 winds down, Larry takes a look back and a look ahead at the economic and political landscape with comments and predictions from some of his favorite guests:
Mike Holland, Holland & Company Chairman John Fund, WSJ OpinionJournal.com Columnist Charles Gasparino, CNBC On Air Editor

item.title: State of the U.S. Economy
item.description:
As the year winds down, Larry checks in on the state of the U.S. Economy. Housing, the Fed, inflation, taxes...it's all here in this wide ranging discussion with James Hamilton, Professor of Economics at the University of California, San Diego and Paul Hoffmeister, Polyconomics Director of Market Strategy.
(For more info on James Hamilton, go to www.econbrowser.com. For more on Paul Hoffmeister, go to www.polyconomics.com.)
item.itunes:author: Larry Kudlow
item.itunes:summary:
As the year winds down, Larry checks in on the state of the U.S. Economy. Housing, the Fed, inflation, taxes...it's all here in this wide ranging discussion with James Hamilton, Professor of Economics at the University of California, San Diego and Paul Hoffmeister, Polyconomics Director of Market Strategy.
(For more info on James Hamilton, go to www.econbrowser.com. For more on Paul Hoffmeister, go to www.polyconomics.com.)

item.title: Market Milestones
item.description:
With the Nikkei passing 15,000, Gold climbing above $500 and the Dow closing in on 11,000, Larry goes around the world to check in on currencies, commodities, and emerging markets with some of his favorite K&Co. guests:
David Malpass, Bear Stearns Chief Economist Mike Churchill, Churchill Research President Craig Russell, Alaron Sr. Foreign Exchange Dealer
(Mike Churchill and his family own all of the companies he discusses in this interview. He has no other conflicts.)

item.title: Holiday Economy
item.description: Larry predicts a big holiday shopping season...for gifts and for stocks. As the malls prepare for their busiest day of the year, Larry talks with Barry Ritholtz, chief market strategist at the Maxim Group, about what's in store for retail and the economy.
item.itunes:author: Larry Kudlow
item.itunes:summary: Larry predicts a big holiday shopping season...for gifts and for stocks. As the malls prepare for their busiest day of the year, Larry talks with Barry Ritholtz, chief market strategist at the Maxim Group, about what's in store for retail and the economy.

item.title: Taxes, Taxes, and more Taxes
item.description: Capital gains, dividends, and windfall profits. Larry check in on Congress in this extended tax discussion with American Shareholders Association Executive Director Daniel Clifton and Prudential Equity Group Sr. Washington Analyst James Lucier.
item.itunes:author: Larry Kudlow
item.itunes:summary: Capital gains, dividends, and windfall profits. Larry check in on Congress in this extended tax discussion with American Shareholders Association Executive Director Daniel Clifton and Prudential Equity Group Sr. Washington Analyst James Lucier.

item.title: Auto Industry Veteran Malcolm Bricklin
item.description: Larry chats with auto industry veteran Malcolm Bricklin, CEO of Visionary Vehicles, about his new effort to import luxury cars from China at a reasonable price.
item.itunes:author: Larry Kudlow
item.itunes:summary: Larry chats with auto industry veteran Malcolm Bricklin, CEO of Visionary Vehicles, about his new effort to import luxury cars from China at a reasonable price.

item.title: New Media Talk with Cody Willard
item.description: With our new Podcast up and running, we thought it would be a good idea to check in on the latest in new media. From video iPods to online digital libraries, Larry covers it all with his old friend Cody Willard (AKA Cody Wyoming) of CL Willard Capital Partners and RealMoney.com. (To learn more about Cody, check out www.thecodyblog.blogspot.com)

item.title: Larry Talks Tech with CNBC's Jim Goldman
item.description: Larry can never get quite enough time with CNBC's Jim Goldman on "Kudlow & Company." For his first Podcast, it therefore made perfect sense to check in with our Silicon Valley Bureau Chief on the state of the tech sector.
item.itunes:author: Larry Kudlow

item.title: Welcome!
item.description: Welcome to the new "Kudlow & Company" Podcast.
